item.title: Coronavirus: Gavin Williamson seeks to reassure parents over school plan
item.description: The education secretary acknowledges some parents are "very anxious" about schools reopening in England.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Busy but manageable' at England's beauty spots
item.description: Meanwhile hundreds of people gathered in London to protest against the lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: Jeremy Corbyn's brother arrested at anti-lockdown protest in London
item.description: Piers Corbyn was among hundreds of demonstrators in London's Hyde Park on Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Coronavirus: Italy takes 'calculated risk' in easing restrictions - PM
item.description: PM Giuseppe Conte says infections could rise again but the country cannot afford to wait for a vaccine.

item.title: Eurovision: Abba's Waterloo voted best song of all time
item.description: Abba topped a BBC show's poll, before the contest producers marked the show that might have been.

item.title: Momentum founder Jon Lansman quits as chairman
item.description: He says it's time to "hand over to a new leadership" of the Labour grassroots campaign group.

item.title: Borussia Dortmund 4-0 Schalke: Haaland scores in Dortmund win on Bundesliga return
item.description: Erling Braut Haaland scores for Borussia Dortmund as they mark the return of the Bundesliga during the coronavirus outbreak with a convincing derby win over Schalke.

item.title: Coronavirus: A third of hospital patients develop dangerous blood clots
item.description: The virus appears to be making people's blood much more sticky, medical experts say.

item.title: Woman in court over Forest of Dean suitcase remains
item.description: Human remains were found in two suitcases in the Forest of Dean on Tuesday night.

item.title: Coronavirus: Mourners honour nurse and parents
item.description: Lillian, 81, and Maurice Dunnington, 85, died days apart, and just two weeks after their son Keith.

item.title: Coronavirus test results waits 'undermining confidence'
item.description: The Royal College of GPs says the government should focus on its testing strategy rather than targets.

item.title: Steve Linick: Trump fires state department inspector general
item.description: Steve Linick was investigating Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, a senior Democrat says.

item.title: The Papers: Rich List losers and 'docs at war on schools'
item.description: Sunday's papers report the annual super-rich survey and unease over the school reopening plan.

item.title: German Bundesliga is back: Which team should you support?
item.description: With the Bundesliga returning this weekend, which team should you choose to support in the final nine games?

item.title: Coronavirus: Grieving together with a yellow heart
item.description: The placing of the symbol in windows is allowing families to celebrate those who have died with Covid-19.

item.title: ICYMI: Seals, North Korea and penguins at a museum
item.description: Here are some stories you may have missed this week.

item.title: Eurovision 2020: Singers from cancelled contest say thank you
item.description: With the song contest cancelled, this year's Eurovision artists have recorded a message for fans.

item.title: Week in pictures: 9-15 May 2020
item.description: A selection of news photographs taken around the world this week.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Lockdown is opportunity of a lifetime for bike lanes'
item.description: Gil Penalosa of urban reform group 8 80 Cities says lockdown is the right time to make cities more bike-friendly.

item.title: RAF Benson's running stormtrooper aims for 1,000 miles
item.description: An RAF squadron leader swaps his uniform for a Star Wars outfit in a bid to raise £50,000.

item.title: Coronavirus: Surrogate babies stranded in Ukraine
item.description: Babies born to surrogate mothers are stuck in Ukraine due to coronavirus lockdown measures.

item.title: Following UK entrant James Newman as he deals with Eurovision's cancellation
item.description: Following UK entrant James Newman as he deals with Eurovision's cancellation, featuring his brother John Newman, Olly Murs, Mollie King as well as other Eurovision contestants.

item.title: How coronavirus is driving a revolution in travel
item.description: Manchester is spearheading a new effort to create space for walking and cycling.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should furloughed workers offer their skills for free?
item.description: Furloughed workers are offering their skills for free, but some freelancers are taking issue with the trend.

item.title: Coronavirus: What should the opposition do in a crisis?
item.description: The coronavirus dilemma faced by Sir Keir Starmer and others whose job it is to criticise the government.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why 'shark attacks' won’t go down as Covid deaths
item.description: Infowars claims about testing, the viral body bag video in Brazil and other claims fact-checked.

item.title: Brexit trade deal: Who really owns UK fishing quotas?
item.description: Reality Check investigates the value of foreign-owned British fishing quotas.

item.title: Afghan maternity ward attackers 'came to kill the mothers'
item.description: The attack on an Afghan maternity unit was "methodical" and no mistake, says charity director.

item.title: Coronavirus: How exposed is your job?
item.description: See how your job compares to others in terms of exposure to disease and closeness to other people.

item.title: Match of the Day: Top 10 podcast - Shearer and Wright reveal their choice of best goals
item.description: There have been some iconic goals scored in recent history - but who did BBC Sport pundits consider the best?

item.title: Disinfected balls, temperature checks & silence - football's new reality?
item.description: The German Bundesliga restarts and gives a glimpse into what the Premier League and other top leagues may look like.

item.title: Sunday's gossip: Mbappe will stay one more season at PSG
item.description: Mbappe to stay at PSG, Juventus close to Pogba deal, Xavi doubts over Mane and Aubameyang for Barca, plus more.

item.title: Olympic champion Stefanidi wins women's garden pole vault
item.description: Olympic champion Katerina Stefanidi wins the women's edition of the garden pole vault challenge.

item.title: NFL's Deandre Baker and Quinton Dunbar surrender after robbery charge
item.description: The two players turned themselves in to police in Florida following charges for armed robbery and aggravated assault.

item.title: How has every club in League Two reacted to the season ending early?
item.description: With the League Two season set to end early, BBC Sport charts how each club in the division reacted to the news.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can you start driving lessons again? And other questions
item.description: Can you start driving lessons again? and other questions answered by BBC experts.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Lockdown update: All you need to know about new measures
item.description: With more restrictions eased in England on Wednesday, how will social and work life be different?

item.title: Coronavirus: How lockdown is being lifted across Europe
item.description: As the UK alters its restrictions, how do other European countries plan to re-open after lockdown?

item.title: Coronavirus: Who should wear a face mask or face covering?
item.description: For the first time, people in England are being advised to wear face coverings in some situations.

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are being done in the UK?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: How will the Covid-19 alert system work?
item.description: The threat of Covid-19 in England is to be ranked through a five-level, colour-coded alert system.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will schools be able to reopen?
item.description: What do schools need to do to make sure they can provide a safe environment for pupils and staff.

item.title: Coronavirus: How much will it cost the UK?
item.description: The pandemic will cost the government hundreds of billions of pounds. Where will it all come from?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Boris Johnson has announced changes to guidelines in England on exercise and social distancing.

item.title: Coronavirus: Will I be able to go on holiday?
item.description: Is it now possible to go on holiday, either in the UK or abroad?

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Am I allowed to move house?
item.description: The easing of lockdown will affect those who want to buy or sell a home, or rent somewhere new, in England.

item.title: Coronavirus: What powers do the police have?
item.description: Police across the UK now have wide-ranging powers to help fight the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: What should I do to stop the virus spreading?
item.description: Step-by-step, what to do to help prevent the spread of the virus.

item.title: How reopened schools in Denmark keep children safely apart
item.description: What's it like in a school that has re-opened? Denmark and Germany show how it might look.

item.title: Coronavirus bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: "Bubbles" of people we can meet safely may form part of the plans to ease lockdown in England.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on public transport?
item.description: Bus and train operators are reducing services and increasing cleaning.

item.title: Coronavirus: Does lockdown easing 'follow the science'?
item.description: Why is England pressing ahead with plans to ease lockdown rules ahead of the rest of the UK?

item.title: Coronavirus: What does it mean if I've been furloughed by work?
item.description: Millions unable to do their job due to coronavirus will have their wages paid by a new scheme.

item.title: How do I travel to work now?
item.description: Some people are being encouraged to go back to work, but how will they get there?

item.title: How to make your own face mask
item.description: Our guide to different types of face coverings and step-by-step instructions on how to make them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do I have to go back to work after lockdown?
item.description: With lockdown restrictions eased, people may start going back to work. But what are your rights?

item.title: Coronavirus R0: What is the R number and why does it matter?
item.description: Experts keep discussing the value of R, but what is it and why does it matter?

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the UK's test, track and trace strategy?
item.description: A guide to the three key parts of the government's coronavirus strategy after lockdowns are eased.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new travel quarantine rules?
item.description: What do you need to know if you're planning to fly during the Covid-19 pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: Labour's Starmer says PM statement 'raises as many questions as answers'
item.description: People are being told to go back to work without clear safety guidance, Labour leader Keir Starmer says.

item.title: Coronavirus and tipping: Will the outbreak make us more generous?
item.description: One service says tips are up 99%, and there's a powerful factor which affects how people give to others.

item.title: Australia Fires: Rescue dog Bear saves scores of koalas
item.description: A koala-detecting dog has come to the rescue in the aftermath of Australia's fires.

item.title: Eurovision: How coronavirus changed the 2020 song contest
item.description: The inside story on this year's cancellation from the artists who were due to sing in Rotterdam.

item.title: Coronavirus: Migrants struggle to send money home
item.description: The Covid-19 pandemic is limiting the ability of people to send and receive money around the world.

item.title: Appalachian Trail: Covid postpones the great American adventure
item.description: For those missing the great outdoors, the mythology of the Appalachian Trail looms large.

item.title: Somalia's coronavirus khat bans leaves chewers in a stew
item.description: Somalia's government curbs the use of khat after raising concern that it could help spread Covid-19.

item.title: Jorge Masvidal: UFC fighter's rise from Miami street fighting scene
item.description: Jorge Masvidal started out fighting in the shadows, in Miami's hidden yards and parking lots. Now he's reached the riches of the UFC.
